issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Hello,
We are using Walrus in our product. We want to be 100% Amazon S3 compatible for our private cloud deployment. We found that Walrus FAILS when we set additional query parameters for the pre-signed URL's.
Here is the test case to reproduce this problem.
============================================================
The problem is that Walrus does not accept any extra query string parameters following the required
?AWSAccessKeyId=xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx&Expires=1346883487&Signature=xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
query string parameters.
Any attempt to add another query string parameter results in a 400 Bad Request. Our product needs to add an extra query string parameter for the Jsonp processing in dojo, so this bug effectively prevents the UI from using the pre-signed URLs that the SM returns to it.
Amazon has no problem with additional query string parameters in a pre-signed URL.
================================================================
Thanks,
Uday Subbarayan,
Chief Architect,
Ciespace Corporation,
Santa Clara, CA
fields.summary: Pre-Signed S3 URL and Additional Query Parameters

comments.body:
Hi Uday,

Is the issue that S3 query parameters are not working in query string auth? For example, adding the acl subresource. Or are you trying to include non-S3 query parameters and just wanting Walrus to ignore them?

Also, what version of Eucalyptus are you using? I am assuming 3.1.x, but if other please specify. Thanks.

-Zach

Hi Zach,
   Here is my response for your questions:

1)Is the issue that S3 query parameters are not working in query string auth? 

Yes.

Here is the example of our actual query string parameters that is NOT working:
GET S3 file: status = 400 location =
http://<host>:8773/services/Walrus/steve-test-bucket/steve-test-object?AWSAccessKeyId=<key>&Expires=1348611082&Signature=<key>&&getData=dojo.io.script.jsonp_dojoIoScript2._jsonpCallback 

2)Then we saw this exception in the Walrus log file:
And here is the /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-error.log for these requests:

3) Or are you trying to include non-S3 query parameters and just wanting Walrus to ignore them?
BIG YES.

The reason is that we are using JSONP to download data inside browser. All we are asking Walrus is to "ignore" it. Here is the actual parameter that we are sending to Walrus.
getData=dojo.io.script.jsonp_dojoIoScript2._jsonpCallback 

4)what version of Eucalyptus are you using?
euca_conf --version
Eucalyptus version: 2.0.2

The reason is that we started while ago. We are OPEN to move to 3.x.

This is super-critical for us. Pl let me know when the fix will be available.

Thanks,
-Uday.

Thanks for the information, Uday. I will look into whether or not the bug is also present in the 3.1 code. I will get back to you with my findings. Thanks for bringing this to our attention. I understand why it would be important for query-string authentication requests.

-Zach

Hi Uday,

I've tested against our 3.2 development code and the bug does not exist. I am currently setting up a 3.1 test environment and will replicate the test to confirm that it is fixed in 3.1 as well.

The test:
GET http://192.168.51.147:8773/services/Walrus/test_bucket_TJVWyuZz8i/test_object_Fwl3N3RLqk?AWSAccessKeyId=I3T6COKP9SP0UYLI2K0PL&Expires=1348856664&Signature=YD0KJiHM%2FGNc58An2VxRqjNoESU%3D&&getData=dojo.io.script.jsonp_dojoIoScript2._jsonpCallback

Successfully returns the data in the object with return code 200. Also tried same thing with only one '&' before the 'getData=...' part, just to be sure and it works just fine as well.

GET http://192.168.51.147:8773/services/Walrus/test_bucket_TJVWyuZz8i/test_object_Fwl3N3RLqk?AWSAccessKeyId=I3T6COKP9SP0UYLI2K0PL&Expires=1348856664&Signature=YD0KJiHM%2FGNc58An2VxRqjNoESU%3D&getData=dojo.io.script.jsonp_dojoIoScript2._jsonpCallback

I will update this ticket again to confirm that 3.1 works as well as the 3.2 development code, but it should as I don't see any changes in that code path recently.

Feel free to download Eucalyptus 3.1 from github at: https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/tree/maint/3.1/master

Or, you can get packages from our package server at http://downloads.eucalyptus.com/software/eucalyptus/3.1/<centos|ubuntu|rhel|source>

You should be able to setup and install a Cloud Controller (CLC) and Walrus only if you want to verify that 3.1 will meet your requirements.

Hope this helps!

-Zach
Ran tests to determine if this issue exists in 3.1 and 3.2 dev. Confirmed it does not exist in 3.2. Checking 3.1 to be sure.

Thanks Zach. Pl update here, if the bug is fixed in 3.1. We will install only controller and Walrus in 3.1 package.

Best,
-Uday.
I have confirmed that the bug does not exist in the 3.1 code using the same test as for the 3.2 dev code. You should be able to use that and let us know if you have problems.
Given no further updates on this issue and [~zhill]'s assertion that it's resolved, I'm closing it.
